item.title: About Me
item.description:
The languages I tend to work with on a regular basis are Python and Rust. Some other languages I enjoy but haven’t found a day-to-day use for yet are Haskell, Elixir, Erlang, and Elm.

My main interests are communications, developer tooling, systems programming, and whatever else happens to pique my interests.

I’m typically known around the Internet as Shrike, SShrike, or just Severen.

Check out my GitHub page if you want to check out what I’ve been up to recently.

Contact

Email

Email me at severen@shrike.me or severen.redwood@gmail.com (both resolve to the same inbox).

Matrix

You can find me on Matrix as #Shrike:matrix.org, this is typically the fatest and preferred way to reach me. You can login as a guest user with the Vector web client.

Twitter

I’m known as @SShrike on Twitter. If you DM me or send me a tweet I’ll probably see it, as the damn fucking thing always spams notifications on my phone.

Cryptography

Use the following profiles to identify my identity on social media, etc.:

  • Keybase Profile
  • OneName Profile

My GPG public key is available here.

item.title: Welcome
item.description:
“Hello world!” I suppose that’s how you’re supposed to open the first post on a programmer’s blog right?

If that wasn’t enough, here’s hello world in some other languages (okay, I’ll admit it, this is just me testing things now):

// C
#include <stdio.h>

int main(int argc, char const *argv[]) {
  printf("Hello world!\n");
  return 0;
}

// Rust
fn main() {
  println!("Hello world!");
}

# Python
print('Hello world!')

-- Haskell
main :: IO ()
main = putStrLn "Hello world!"
